House Bill/Resolution NO. PS00071
FULL TITLE : PROMOTING THE FILM INDUSTRY IN THE PHILIPPINES
SHORT TITLE : Movie Industry
ABSTRACT : Rep. De Venecia delved first on the success of the film “Ang Babaeng Humayo” or “The Woman Who Left” that recently won several awards abroad. In this light, he congratulated the films’s director Lav Diaz who was also its screenwriter, cinematographer, editor and coproducer, for his unparalleled vision, genius and unwavering commitment to his craft. He also commended the actors and producers of Mr. Diaz’ films including those whom he further enumerated. Citing measures promoting Filipino films that Congress passed during the speakership of his father, former Speaker Jose C. De Venecia, he asked the Body to pass similar bills filed in the 17th Congress. He also relayed the advocacies of several art groups and summits for the protection of artists welfare and a Film Archive; and stressed the role of culture in entertainment, social transformation, and economic growth. (SOURCE: House Journal No.22,p.15)
